hypothesis_content.title: Term Structure Flattening Predictive of Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 7-day implied volatility exceeds 30-day implied volatility by less than 2% points (near-flat or inverted term structure) during a NEUTRAL regime, there's an 80% probability of transitioning to either BULL or STRESS regime within 5 trading days, with direction determined by spot price relative to volume-weighted average price.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Flat/inverted volatility term structure during neutral periods indicates market expectation of imminent catalyst. Current Trump crypto narrative and JPMorgan's $170K BTC prediction create asymmetric information environment. The flattening represents options market pricing in binary outcome events.
entry_conditions: Spot price either > VWAP(20) + 1% OR < VWAP(20) - 1%
Term structure flattening occurs after 5+ days of declining volatility

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Term structure re-steepens (>5% points difference) without regime change

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If flat term structure persists in neutral regime for >10 days without regime transition in >60% of historical instances.
